title: asicprince
author: asicprince
content: 1659996b0fb053a589b88a0e005b4c54ef22bc0f451e2dcf3c14437877d70de9above is my TXid, pending for 26days. Tried to use BTCnitro/com to push it up but not work (they didn't refund me as they said, don't try)Can somebody help me out so my transaction can be confirmed or btc back to my wallet to make a new transaction? I used Viawallet when send it(and viabtc accelerator is too expensive, cost me more than $400 so forget it)another interesting thing is while i send 0.08478975btc, now on explorer show it's 0.07618310 only

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: The transaction fee rate of 11sat/vbyte which is $4 for transaction fee is way too low. The transaction fee will have been ok but those inputs are way too much to get it past through. Also the wallet you’re sending from doesn’t support any means of bumping transaction and it seems they are rebroadcasting the transaction again. If you have private keys to the receiving address I will advice you import it to maybe you electrum wallet if there is funds there you do CPFP. The transaction doesn’t looks like something that will drop now. Also i just check the mempool.space accelerator too it is expensive too around $21, if it’s ok by you try it. But do not use any accelerator apart from this and viabtc i think they just take your money and rebroadcast transaction only Also the total receiving amount is still 0.08478975 and not 0.07628310 has you have said

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: asicprince on December 05, 2023, 03:46:50 PM1659996b0fb053a589b88a0e005b4c54ef22bc0f451e2dcf3c14437877d70de9above is my TXid, pending for 26days. Tried to use BTCnitro/com to push it up but not work (they didn't refund me as they said, don't try)Can somebody help me out so my transaction can be confirmed or btc back to my wallet to make a new transaction? I used Viawallet when send it(and viabtc accelerator is too expensive, cost me more than $400 so forget it)another interesting thing is while i send 0.08478975btc, now on explorer show it's 0.07618310 only  Your transaction will not get confirmed and it will probably drop from nodes in some weeks.I suggest that you use the accelerator from mempool.space,  as you didn't use RBF (replace by fee).You will have to pay to get it confirmed. I never used this service,  but this site is legithttps://mempool.space/en/tx/1659996b0fb053a589b88a0e005b4c54ef22bc0f451e2dcf3c14437877d70de9

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: The fee rate used for your transaction is below the purging fee rate for any node with default mempool size. Therefore, there are many nodes that don't have your transaction in their mempool now. Import your wallet to electrum. There's a change you don't see your unconfirmed transaction and you can make a new one. If you see your transaction in electrum, try connecting to different servers until you find a one that doesn't have your transaction. Once you connect to a node that doesn't have your transaction, your transaction status will change to local and you can remove it from your wallet using right-click menu and then make a new one. Download electrum only from its official website.

comments.author: bitmover
comments.body: Quote from: asicprince on December 05, 2023, 04:04:46 PMit's 4 weeks already, my wallet doesn't support RBF so i can't do anything but wait it got confirmed or btc back to my walletYou can pay directly to a mineer using mempool.space accelerate button. Or you can try hosseinimr93 suggestion, which may work if your transaction is already dropped from most nodes.

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: asicprince on December 05, 2023, 04:11:07 PMhttps://www.blockchain.com/explorer/addresses/btc/1LibturcEyL7ZyGLLLfmHziWfUS19P8J79this site show transaction amount is 0.07628310https://blockchair.com/bitcoin/address/1LibturcEyL7ZyGLLLfmHziWfUS19P8J79this site even show my balance is 0.07628310 What you’re looking at is a single address which has a total of 0.07628310 but there are other two addresses that makes the accumulation to be 0.08478975 you can check the transaction hash  https://mempool.space/tx/1659996b0fb053a589b88a0e005b4c54ef22bc0f451e2dcf3c14437877d70de9.

comments.author: BabyBandit
comments.created_time: December 05, 2023, 06:38:49 PMLast edit: December 05, 2023, 07:00:30 PM by BabyBandit
comments.body: No exp using Viawallet. But cant you just increase the TX fee in the wallet you using? Many wallets have a option like that and the wallet I using got it.For next time check https://mempool.space/ before sending the TX and don't be Cheap Charlie. Good luck mate!  Thanks  @jrrsparkles @hosseinimr93 for clarifying.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: BabyBandit on December 05, 2023, 06:38:49 PMNo exp using Viawallet. But cant you just increase the TX fee in the wallet you using? Many wallets have a option like that and the wallet I using got it.OP's transaction has not been flagged as RBF which means that's not supported by ViaWallet and there shouldn't be any option to increase the fee in the wallet. Of course, as I said in my previous post, there are many nodes that have dropped OP's transaction from their mempool and should accept a new transaction with the same inputs.

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: BabyBandit on December 05, 2023, 06:38:49 PMNo exp using Viawallet. But cant you just increase the TX fee in the wallet you using? Many wallets have a option like that and the wallet I using got it.For next time check https://mempool.space/ before sending the TX and don't be Cheap Charlie. Good luck mate!  Unfortunately, the TX isn't RBF and still, not a lot of wallets implemented the RBF feature so it's not a big surprise also the fee estimators on the wallet app suck so OP unknowingly send the funds without realizing the mempool status, and trusted the wallet suggested fee.But the good thing is Viawallet provides private keys that can be used to import in electrum like wallet and make new transactions with the fee required at that time once nodes drop this transaction from mempool.

comments.author: hosemary
comments.body: Quote from: jrrsparkles on December 05, 2023, 06:56:36 PMBut the good thing is Viawallet provides private keys that can be used to import in electrum like wallet and make new transactions with the fee required at that time once nodes drop this transaction from mempool.Many nodes have already dropped OP's transaction from their mempool.At the time I am writing this post, according to mempool.space, the purging fee rate is 15 sat/vbyte. This means that any transaction with the fee rate of less than 15 sat/vbyte is purged from mempool of any node with default mempool size.

Therefore, there are many nodes that don't have your transaction in their mempool now. Import your wallet to electrum. There's a change you don't see your unconfirmed transaction and you can make a new one. If you see your transaction in electrum, try connecting to different servers until you find a one that doesn't have your transaction. Once you connect to a node that doesn't have your transaction, your transaction status will change to local and you can remove it from your wallet using right-click menu and then make a new one. Download electrum only from its official website.Thanks for your advice. imported and my balance still in wallet, i made new transaction and it seem to be fine now

comments.author: jrrsparkles
comments.body: Quote from: asicprince on December 06, 2023, 01:43:28 AMThanks for your advice. imported and my balance still in wallet, i made new transaction and it seem to be fine nowGood to know that, but did you use the right fee this time so that the transaction won't get stuck like before?TX fees keep climbing up along with the price of bitcoin so now again the network is highly congested and fee required becomes crazy compared to last week's mempool status.

comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: Quote from: asicprince on December 06, 2023, 01:43:28 AMi made new transaction and it seem to be fine nowThat's $90 in fees for less than 1 kB For future reading: my topic on consolidating inputs and transaction fees. Using Segwit also helps.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on December 05, 2023, 04:27:39 PMDownload electrum only from its official website.Verify the Electrum wallet too.[GUIDE] How to Safely Download and Verify Electrum.In Electrum wallet, there are three options to choose fee rate when broadcasting a transaction [3]. I would like to use Mempools but still have to double check it with mempool observing websites like [1, 2] and don't totally rely on information from Electrum wallet.[1] https://mempool.space/[2] https://jochen-hoenicke.de/queue/#BTC%20(default%20mempool),24h,weight[3] Minimize your transaction fee with Electrum wallet
